intro.text: This practice guides you through four essential mindfulness techniques: body awareness, object observation, thought visualization, and reflection. Each step includes a 5-minute timer to help you stay focused.

sections.title: Body Awareness Scan
sections.instructions: Sit comfortably and focus on the sensations in your body, from your toes to the top of your head. Observe any tension, warmth, or tingling without judgment.
sections.question: What did you notice in your body?
sections.placeholder: Describe any sensations, tension, warmth, tingling, or areas of relaxation you observed...

sections.title: Object Observation
sections.instructions: Choose a small, neutral object nearby. Spend 5 minutes observing it using all your senses. Notice its color, texture, shape, weight, and any other qualities.
sections.customObjectPlaceholder: OR describe your own object choice....
sections.question: What did you observe about your object?
sections.placeholder: Describe its color, texture, shape, weight, temperature, smell, or any other qualities you noticed...

sections.title: Thought Visualization
sections.instructions: Imagine your thoughts as clouds drifting across the sky or leaves floating down a stream. Notice each thought without holding onto it and let it pass naturally.
sections.question: What thoughts did you notice?
sections.placeholder: Describe the thoughts that came up and how you visualized them passing by....

sections.title: Reflection
sections.instructions: Reflect on your mindfulness practice. What did you notice? How did it feel to focus on the present moment?
sections.question: Your reflection:
sections.placeholder: What did you notice during this practice? How did it feel to focus on the present moment? What was challenging or easy about staying present?
